qas.question: Who did the Ming cut off all relations with?
What year did the Ming cut off the Karmapa hierarchs?
Who did the Ming court think the representatives were sent by?

context: Despite this glowing message by the Emperor, Chan writes that a year later in <a1_0>1446<a1_0/>, the Ming court cut off all relations with <a0_0><a3_0>the Karmapa<a3_0/> hierarchs<a0_0/>. Until then, the court was unaware that Deshin Shekpa had died in <a2_0>1415<a2_0/>. The Ming court had believed that the representatives of the Karma Kagyu who continued to visit the Ming capital were sent by the Karmapa.
